trans-unit.source: The concatenation operator, <codeph>||</codeph>, concatenates its right operand to the end of its left operand. It operates on character or bit expressions.

seg-source.mrk: The concatenation operator, <codeph>||</codeph>, concatenates its right operand to the end of its left operand.
It operates on character or bit expressions.

target.mrk: The concatenation operator, <codeph>||</codeph>, concatenates its right operand to the end of its left operand.
It operates on character or bit expressions.

trans-unit.source: Because all built-in data types are implicitly converted to strings, this function can act on all built-in data types.

seg-source.mrk: Because all built-in data types are implicitly converted to strings, this function can act on all built-in data types.

target.mrk: Because all built-in data types are implicitly converted to strings, this function can act on all built-in data types.

trans-unit.source: For character strings, if both the left and right operands are of type CHAR, the resulting type is CHAR; otherwise, it is VARCHAR. The normal blank padding/trimming rules for CHAR and VARCHAR apply to the result of this operator.

seg-source.mrk: For character strings, if both the left and right operands are of type CHAR, the resulting type is CHAR; otherwise, it is VARCHAR.
The normal blank padding/trimming rules for CHAR and VARCHAR apply to the result of this operator.

target.mrk: For character strings, if both the left and right operands are of type CHAR, the resulting type is CHAR; otherwise, it is VARCHAR.
The normal blank padding/trimming rules for CHAR and VARCHAR apply to the result of this operator.

trans-unit.source: The length of the resulting string is the sum of the lengths of both operands.

seg-source.mrk: The length of the resulting string is the sum of the lengths of both operands.

target.mrk: The length of the resulting string is the sum of the lengths of both operands.

trans-unit.source: For bit strings, if both the left and the right operands are of type CHAR FOR BIT DATA, the resulting type is CHAR FOR BIT DATA; otherwise, it is VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA.

seg-source.mrk: For bit strings, if both the left and the right operands are of type CHAR FOR BIT DATA, the resulting type is CHAR FOR BIT DATA; otherwise, it is VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA.

target.mrk: For bit strings, if both the left and the right operands are of type CHAR FOR BIT DATA, the resulting type is CHAR FOR BIT DATA; otherwise, it is VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA.

trans-unit.source: -- returns 'supercalifragilisticexbealidocious(sp?)' VALUES 'supercalifragilistic' || 'exbealidocious' || '(sp?)' -- returns NULL VALUES CAST (null AS VARCHAR(7))|| 'AString' -- returns '130asdf' VALUES '130' || 'asdf'

seg-source.mrk: -- returns 'supercalifragilisticexbealidocious(sp?)' VALUES 'supercalifragilistic' || 'exbealidocious' || '(sp?)' -- returns NULL VALUES CAST (null AS VARCHAR(7))|| 'AString' -- returns '130asdf' VALUES '130' || 'asdf'

target.mrk: -- returns 'supercalifragilisticexbealidocious(sp?)' VALUES 'supercalifragilistic' || 'exbealidocious' || '(sp?)' -- returns NULL VALUES CAST (null AS VARCHAR(7))|| 'AString' -- returns '130asdf' VALUES '130' || 'asdf'
